events.title: Charles Dickens' Farewell Public Reading
events.description: Charles Dickens gave his last public reading in England, performing excerpts from his works before his health declined further.
events.significance: This marked the end of Dickens' public engagement with his audience, signifying the closing chapter of the career of one of the Victorian era's greatest novelists.

events.title: Krakatoa Begins Erupting
events.description: The volcanic island of Krakatoa in Indonesia began a series of eruptions that would culminate in one of the most violent volcanic events in recorded history a few days later.
events.significance: The eruptions led to global climatic effects and massive loss of life, underlining the power of natural disasters to impact global weather and societies.

events.title: First Production of a Practical Airplane by Glenn Curtiss
events.description: Aviation pioneer Glenn Curtiss made the first flight with the first practical airplane engine designed and built in the United States.
events.significance: This innovation was pivotal in the advancement of aviation technology in the U.S., contributing to the early development of motorized flight.

events.title: Battle of Stalingrad Begins
events.description: One of the deadliest battles in World War II began as Axis forces launched their assault on the Soviet city of Stalingrad.
events.significance: The battle became a turning point in the war, marking the beginning of the Soviet pushback that would eventually lead to Allied victory in Europe.

events.title: Mariner 2 Spacecraft Flies by Venus
events.description: NASA's Mariner 2 spacecraft performed a successful flyby of Venus, the first successful mission to another planet.
events.significance: This mission provided important data about the Venusian atmosphere and surface temperature, marking a milestone in interplanetary exploration.
